devil_mark.description: Torture ordered to include pricking for mark, but no result mentioned

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: PG des Vosges received information that she is greatly feared as a witch; also accused by Claude femme Jacquot Marlier de Vomécourt (convicted at Donipaire). Orders receveur of Mirecourt to take information secretly.

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Initial witness depositions (witnesses 1-7)

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: PG des Vosges orders arrest and hearing of further witnesses

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Additional depositions (witnesses 8-23)

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: First interrogation; said she was about 60; denied all charges

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Continued interrogation; denied all charges

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Receveur took accused to Dompaire under armed guard for confrontation with woman of Vomécourt (Claude femme Jacquot Marlier); woman discharged all named and made no charge against Annon before execution

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Confrontations with Jean Dirand, Jean Mathieu le jeune, Nicolas Chiepart, Esdeline femme Jean Mathieu le jeune, Jean Vincent

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Request to PG des Vosges on behalf of accused for communication of trial documents

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Change de Nancy says accused should not see trial documents; PG des Vosges should give opinion on next stage

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Further request to Duke for access to documents; Duke consents to request

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Copy of documents delivered to accused, her son Jean, and Sr Du Menil (her counsellor)

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Detailed legal submission on behalf of Annon challenging witness credibility and evidence; Response from PG des Vosges

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Opinion from two jurists (de Landrian and Vincens) recommending torture and pricking for devil's mark

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: PG des Vosges orders torture to proceed

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Interrogation before torture; continued to deny all charges

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; given thumbscrews, rack, and tortillons; stoutly denied all charges; called on Virgin Mary

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: Post-torture interrogation; continued to deny being a witch

timeline.subject: Annon Bourguignotte
timeline.details: PG des Vosges suggests she be renvoyée (released) after satisfying reasonable costs of trial

torture.restrictions: Question ordinaire et extraordinaire approved; torture to be preceded by shaving and pricking for devil's mark

accomplices_named.name: Claude femme Jacquot Marlier
accomplices_named.context: Accused Annon; just convicted of witchcraft at Donipaire

accomplices_named.name: Other witches (unnamed)
accomplices_named.context: Devil during exorcisms said there were 5 witches in Gallay family; Jean Vincent said Annon had companions at Bettoncourt

prior_accusations.context: Accused Annon before being executed; when confronted before execution, she discharged all she had named including Annon
During exorcisms of multiple possessed individuals, devil named Annon as having given the bewitchment

notable_quotes.speaker: Annon Bourguignotte
notable_quotes.french: Balthazard si je l'estois je n'en serois la cause je suis de sy bonne race
notable_quotes.english: Balthazard if I were [a witch] I would not be the cause; I am of such good race
notable_quotes.context: Said to guard Balthazard de France after arrest when he said evidence showed she must be a witch; suggested she might have been under compulsion from husband or others

notable_quotes.speaker: Annon Bourguignotte
notable_quotes.french: que l'on a envie de la faire brusler sans estre sorciere
notable_quotes.english: they want to burn me without being a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Annon Bourguignotte (to Jeannon Dirand)
notable_quotes.french: Comment me donne tu le bon jour, puisque tu m'en veu tant
notable_quotes.english: How do you give me good day, since you want so much [ill] of me
notable_quotes.context: Quarrel with Jeannon before her death

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeannon Dirand
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle rendroit bientost compte a dieu
notable_quotes.english: that she would soon give account to God
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Annon; Jeannon fell ill a week later and died

notable_quotes.speaker: Esdeline femme Jean Mathieu (daughter of Annon to her)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle aymeroit mieulx veoir ladite sa belle soeur au gibet que de la veoir en la race desdits Gallay
notable_quotes.english: that she would rather see her sister-in-law on the gibbet than see her in the Gallay race
notable_quotes.context: Said by Annon's daughter Claude about her sister-in-law who had long cried that she was not given Annon's brother for husband

notable_quotes.speaker: Annon Bourguignotte (under torture)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle enduroit son martir patiemment en l'honneur de la passion de nre Seigneur
notable_quotes.english: that she endured her martyrdom patiently in honor of the passion of our Lord
notable_quotes.context: Said during torture while calling on Virgin Mary; stoutly denied all charges

notable_quotes.speaker: Mansuy (son of Demenge Maguison) to Annon
notable_quotes.french: O sorciere, le veux tu guerir
notable_quotes.english: Oh witch, do you want to cure it
notable_quotes.context: Said about his father's sick horse after it became ill following damage to Gallay's field

notable_quotes.speaker: Annon Bourguignotte
notable_quotes.french: Jesus Maria, je ne luy ay pas donné
notable_quotes.english: Jesus Mary, I did not give it to her
notable_quotes.context: Exclamation when asked if she made Mathieu's wife ill during first interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Annon's defense (legal submission)
notable_quotes.french: que la plus grande partie des prevenus estans gens imbecilles et de petit jugement ils ne peuvent scavoir ce qui peut servir a leur justification
notable_quotes.english: that the greater part of accused being feeble people of little judgment, they cannot know what can serve for their justification
notable_quotes.context: Legal argument for why accused should see trial documents

economic_context.details: Multiple quarrels involved property and animals: horse damaging crops in Gallay's field; cow taken back to Annon's house; lawsuit between husbands 25 years earlier. Marriage alliance dispute involving economic interests of families. Multiple animal deaths (horses, cows) representing significant economic loss to witnesses.

harms_catalog.method_alleged: Advised to get bread and salt from his house; child recovered after

harms_catalog.harm_description: Could not walk; those who saw him thought he would never walk
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Cured 5 months later when Annon asked to see him and advised pilgrimage; immediately began to walk

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill as if rabid and died 4 days later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Horse had damaged crops in Gallay's field
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Believed she made it ill and could have cured it

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Annon reproached her that she gave nothing to the godchild
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Exorcised by curé of Dommartin-les-Toul who told her she was bewitched

harms_catalog.harm_description: Bewitched; effects redoubled several times; cries, strange movements, convulsions; went into convulsive movements every time she saw or heard Annon's name
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Annon stole a scarf and wouldn't return it, so witness stole one back; also refused to enter service of Annon's mother

harms_catalog.harm_description: Bewitched over last 4 years; felt effects every time he met Annon; unable to speak until exorcisms
Lost more animals than anyone else in village
Fell ill; limbs became paralyzed, eyes turned in head, lost speech; felt like fire in body on other occasions when she passed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Took cow back to her house and told her he would take caution; she passed in front of him giving keys to daughter
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Curé advised him to look in pillow where he found oats, barley, fishbones, twisted feathers, oak twigs, cloth, and other things

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute with Jean Gallay; didn't use Jean Gallay and sister Claude as godparents; thought done in disdain
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 2 years after dispute; between St Martin and Chandeleur
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Anointed with plate of ointment Annon sent, but curé advised burning it; gave green flame and bad smell when put on fire; also fresh butter to rub on child after pilgrimage

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell ill a week after quarrel; tongue swollen until it filled her mouth; died in another week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over illness of brother's child; Jeannon passed before Annon and cursed whoever was responsible
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: Fell ill a week later; died another week after that
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Annon responded with remark about accounting to God

harms_catalog.victim_name: Girl servant in house of Demenge Jean Maire
harms_catalog.harm_description: Believed herself bewitched and still suffering
harms_catalog.method_alleged: All in household thought she was bewitched by Annon

harms_catalog.harm_description: Attacked in his garden by a hideous creature the size of a calf which tried to strangle him; jumped against him 3-4 times before disappearing against a wall
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Believed accused had transformed herself into hideous creature

Annon had stolen a scarf from Isabelle Remy and wouldn't return it, so Isabelle stole one back
Bread which Annon brought to Isabelle; kept under coat for long time; tasted bad and gave great pains; also bread and salt from Annon's house used for counter-magic
Advised to get bread and salt from Gallay house for counter-magic; maire took some for counter-magic
Found in pillow of Thiery Pieron after he became ill; curé advised him to look there
Found in pillow of Thiery Pieron
Found in pillow of Thiery Pieron
Found in pillow of Thiery Pieron
Found in pillow of Thiery Pieron among other magical objects

Annon gave fresh butter to rub on sick child; child recovered after, expelling 'bois de chanvre' from nose

material_culture.object: bean pod shell (escorce de febve) with snail inside
material_culture.context: Found in well near cross of Vomécourt one foot from water; devil during exorcisms revealed its location; curé threw it in fire; when it burned, other bewitched women convulsed violently
Devil during exorcisms declared it was under foot of bed in back chamber of Mathieu house; Annon guarded it
Curé of Vomécourt advised Thiery Pieron to look in his pillow where magical objects were hidden
Annon passed in front of Thiery Pieron on pretext of giving keys to daughter

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and many witnesses

Location of receveur who was ordered to take information against Annon
Location of Change de Nancy (court); legal consultation with Mr Echevin and Eschevins of Nancy
Field where horse damaged crops, precipitating quarrel
Garden where small black dog was seen; where 3 or 4 figures in form of sheep went after sabbat-like gathering
Where Annon came to speak about sick horse with Mansuy
Pilgrimage location where Isabelle Remy went previous year; went into convulsions when Annon looked at her
Where Aubry Poirot and others saw circle of people dressed in white dancing around man in black; then violent hailstorm
Where he was attacked by hideous creature believed to be Annon transformed
Where Isabelle Remy went into convulsive movements every time; where Jean Mathieu le viel saw prisoner from Donipaire before she went to his house
Where magical object (bean pod with snail) was hidden one foot from water; devil revealed location during exorcisms; Dedier Begin descended into well to retrieve it
Where Annon's daughter was married; ointment allegedly came from 'la Damoiselle femme du sieur Vallee' there; Annon was crossing stream on way to Charmes when maire of Pont tried to let her drown
Where Annon was crossing on way to Charmes; maire of Pont prevented his wife from helping her, saying to let her drown
Location of maire who tried to let Annon drown in stream
Where quarrel between Didier Gallay and older Mathieu occurred, leading to lawsuit
Where curé exorcised wife of Nicolas Chepart
Where devil said toad skin was hidden under foot of bed
Previous residence of Jean Mathieu; devil said a devil guarded sorts there

emotional_state_notes: Exclaimed 'Jesus Maria, je ne luy ay pas donné' when asked if she made Mathieu's wife ill
Said 'que l'on a envie de la faire brusler sans estre sorciere'
Called on Virgin Mary during torture
Declared she endured martyrdom patiently in honor of passion of our Lord
Said soul was dearer to her than anything in world; would have confessed if guilty to save soul
Stoutly denied all charges under torture

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said there had been occasion when crossing stream on way to Charmes, maire of Pont and wife went to help her, but Nicolas Chepart prevented them saying they should let her drown - he admitted this
Said wife of Jean Mathieu le jeune 'a faict plusieurs imprecations a son marit et ne scayt si elles sont retombées sur elle'
As for wife of Nicolas Chepart, on account of her ingratitude she was known as 'la peu bonne' at Vomécourt

Said she sent ointment to treat his wife's breasts; had been sent by her daughter married at Charmes from 'la Damoiselle femme du sieur Vallee'; he claimed wife had nothing wrong with breasts at that time
Said Jean Vincent's sobbing and barking like dog was malicious and she was not responsible for his state

third_parties.context: Tried to help Annon cross stream but prevented by husband

third_parties.name: Other bewitched women of Vomécourt
third_parties.context: When curé burned magical object from well, these women convulsed so violently several people couldn't hold them; Annon was suspected of having given them their sorts

third_parties.name: Man in black

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a remarkably well-documented trial with extensive legal defense. Annon Bourguignotte survived torture and was released, making this a rare non-death outcome. The trial features extensive testimony about demonic possession and exorcisms, detailed legal arguments about evidence standards, and significant defense by counsel (Sr Du Menil). The accused received unusual access to trial documents after appeal to the Duke. Notable for the quality of legal defense and the accused's steadfast denial under torture. The case involves complex family disputes over marriage alliances and demonstrates sophisticated legal arguments about witness credibility and evidence standards in witchcraft trials.
